comments:
I have an SQL DataSet with the following query:
select bo_detail.detailID,
bo_detail.entryID
from bo_detail
where bo_detail.entryID = ?

I have defined a parameter:
eid Decimal Input 1

However, the DataSet will not save.  Instead I get a message to look in the log file for an error message (see below).  Any thoughts on what I'm missing?

Without the parameter and where statement, everything works.  Both the detailID and entryID are BigInts in MySQL.

Chris....

*** Bug 150832 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Something a little wierd though.  If I hand edit the XML and modify the sql query, everything works.  I still can't open the dataset in the GUI though.  I get the error described below.

Any thoughts?  I am using the latest version of BIRT as installed via the update site:  http://download.eclipse.org/birt/update-site
If #3 is a question to me, no I was using the latest release (via the update site)  and the report was created new in that version of the application.

Thanks for choosing BIRT.
Seems to me the problem is the parameter is somehow missing.
The bug, though, can't be reproduced by simply following your description.
Note I didn't see you did anything wrong either.
Please give our lastest build a try using the recommended jdbc driver mysql-connector-java-3.1.13 available on MySQL website.
If the problem still exists, please attach the design file and give me more info on the database/table you used so that further investigation could be taken,Regards
If I get the error again I will attach a copy of the report to a new Bug (I don't have that version any more).

I am closing the bug as worksforme.
Should you have any further problem, please feel free to reopen it.
